new_p_242: Taking out a mortgage is probably the largest and most significant financial transaction you'll make in your lifetime. For most young couples, buying a first home is a dream come true, but the path to it is fraught with bureaucracy, complex banking terms, and fateful decisions that will affect your bank account for decades. The purpose of this guide is to organize the chaos and explain in simple language the steps on the way to your desired mortgage.
new_p_244: Before you even start looking for an apartment, you must understand your budget. Pre-approval is an official document from the bank confirming that the bank is willing to give you a loan, and for what amount. Getting approval depends on your income, previous commitments, and your credit history. Mortgage consultation at this stage is critical to understand your financing limits and prevent the heartache of signing a contract without financing capability.
new_p_246: This is the most important stage where the value of mortgage consultation for first-time buyers is measured. The bank will offer you different tracks (prime, fixed linked, variable, etc.), but the bank's interest is to maximize its profits. Our job is to build a portfolio for you that spreads risks, saves on interest costs, and is tailored to your monthly repayment capacity and your family's future plans (such as expanding the family or study funds expected to be released).
new_p_248: After we have a desired portfolio, we go out to tender interest rates with different banks. This is where an experienced mortgage advisor can save you tens and even hundreds of thousands of shekels. Banks compete for good clients, and professional knowledge allows for pressing interest rates downward much more effectively than a private individual coming to a branch.
new_p_250: After choosing the winning bank, the bureaucracy stage begins: property appraisals, life and building insurance, registering warning notices and mortgages. This is a technical but very important stage, where any delay can cause failure to meet payment schedules in the purchase contract. Professional guidance ensures all documents are submitted correctly and quickly.
new_p_251: Remember: A mortgage is a complex financial product. Don't deal with it alone. Professional mortgage consultation is an investment that pays for itself many times over in long-term savings and peace of mind throughout the entire process.
new_p_268: Many tend to think that a mortgage is a "Catholic wedding" for 25 or 30 years, and that once we've signed - that's it. But the truth is that a mortgage is a dynamic product. The market changes, interest rates in the economy rise and fall, and your personal situation also changes (promotion at work, inheritance, or heaven forbid a decrease in income). Mortgage refinancing and terms improvement is a powerful financial tool that allows you to open your existing mortgage and rebuild it under better terms.
new_p_270: Mortgage refinancing is a process where we take a new mortgage to pay off the old mortgage. The goal is almost always one of two things: either to reduce the monthly payment to ease the current financial burden, or to shorten the mortgage period to save on accumulated interest payments and finish with the debt faster. Often, through proper mortgage consultation, it's possible to achieve both goals together.
new_p_272:
There are several junctures where you must check your mortgage:

1. Change in economy interest rates: If you took a mortgage during a period of high interest rates and now rates have dropped, there's potential for huge savings.

2. Change in financial status: If your income has increased, consider increasing the monthly payment and shortening the years. This will save you a lot of money.

3. Receiving a lump sum: A released study fund or inheritance can be used to pay off part of the mortgage as part of refinancing.

4. Difficulty with monthly payments: If you're facing cash flow difficulties, refinancing can redistribute the loan and reduce the monthly payment.
new_p_274: One of the important things in checking refinancing feasibility is the early repayment fee (exit penalty). Sometimes the interest savings are large, but the penalty makes the move unprofitable. A mortgage advisor for housing improvers and refinancers will perform an accurate calculation for you including all associated fees, to ensure you're actually saving net money and not just "on paper".
new_p_275: Warm recommendation: Don't let your mortgage "sleep" for long years without checking. A feasibility check for refinancing once every year or two could be worth a lot of money to you. Contact us for a professional check without obligation.
new_p_292: Many families in Israel find themselves in a financial trap: they have a mortgage, and over the years have added a car loan, renovation loan, overdraft coverage loan, and other credit card obligations. The result is a monthly payment that strangles the family and prevents them from managing normally. The solution of loan consolidation through mortgage (all-purpose loan) is one of the most effective tools for getting out of financial trouble.
new_p_294: The idea is simple: commercial (regular) loans are usually given for short periods of 3-5 years at relatively high interest rates. In contrast, a mortgage can be spread over 20 or 30 years, and the interest rates are (usually) lower because the bank has strong collateral (the property). In the loan consolidation process, we take an addition to the existing mortgage against the property, and use this money to close all the small and expensive loans.
new_p_296: The effect is immediate and dramatic. A family that was paying 4,000 NIS on a mortgage plus another 5,000 NIS on various loans (total 9,000 NIS), can after loan consolidation find themselves with a total monthly payment of only 5,500 NIS. This difference – 3,500 NIS that remains net each month – is the oxygen that allows the family to return to balance and live with dignity.
new_p_298: Loan consolidation is suitable for those who own real estate property, and whose current mortgage value is less than 50% of the property value (usually it's possible to reach up to 50% financing for debt closure, and sometimes even more with non-bank solutions). It's very important to perform this move with professional mortgage consultation, to ensure you don't endanger the property and to build a recovery plan that will prevent you from returning to the same debts in the future.
new_p_300: It's important to remember that spreading the debt over many years increases the total interest you'll pay at the end of the period. Therefore, loan consolidation is a solution designed to solve a current cash flow problem ('firefighting'). If you can handle the current payments, we won't always recommend this move. But if you're in chronic overdraft and struggling to make ends meet, this is a real lifeline.

new_p_318: Winning the "Discounted Apartment" lottery (formerly Buyer's Price) is a joyful event that can save you hundreds of thousands of shekels when purchasing your first apartment. However, taking a mortgage in these projects is fundamentally different from buying an apartment in the free market. There are unique rules designed to make it easier for you, but also complex bureaucracy that's important to know to avoid losing eligibility or making costly mistakes.
new_p_320: The biggest advantage in a mortgage for a discounted apartment is how banks calculate the property value. While in the free market the bank provides financing according to the contract price, in these projects the bank may give you a mortgage according to the real market value of the apartment (as determined by an appraiser), not according to the discounted price at which you purchased it. The meaning: you can get a very high financing percentage relative to the purchase price, thus requiring significantly lower equity (minimum 100,000 NIS or 10%, whichever is higher).
new_p_322: Unlike a second-hand apartment where you pay and receive keys, here we're talking about purchasing "on paper". Payments to the contractor are linked to the construction input index, which can make the apartment more expensive by tens of thousands of shekels throughout the construction period. Mortgage consultation for first apartments in these projects focuses on building a smart payment strategy – should you advance payments to the contractor to save on the index? And when to start paying the mortgage (grace period)?
new_p_324: Despite the benefits, there are difficulties: banks sometimes harden their positions on interest rates for Buyer's Price winners, and the process with contractors can be slow and exhausting. Additionally, there's a prohibition on selling the apartment for several years (usually 5 years from receiving Form 4 or 7 years from winning), which requires long-term planning.
new_p_326: The complexity of calculating financing percentages, dealing with appraisers, and the need to maneuver between current rent payments and future mortgage payments requires a guiding hand. We're here to ensure you take advantage of all the benefits you're entitled to and that you won't be surprised by unexpected costs on the way to your apartment.

new_p_360: Taking out a mortgage is the biggest financial transaction of your life. A small mistake in the planning stage can cost you hundreds of thousands of shekels over the years. In this article, we'll review the main pitfalls and how professional mortgage consulting can save you from them.
new_p_363: Most people take out a mortgage once or twice in their lifetime. In contrast, banks conduct such transactions thousands of times a day. These knowledge gaps create a situation where borrowers approach the deal from a distinctly disadvantaged position. Without objective mortgage consulting, it's very easy to fall into marketing traps that seem attractive in the short term but are destructive in the long run.
new_p_364: Many think a mortgage is a uniform off-the-shelf product, but in reality it's a "suit" that needs to be tailored precisely to your measurements. When we approach the process of first-time home buyer mortgage consulting, we repeatedly encounter the same basic errors that keep repeating themselves. Here's the complete list of mistakes you should know before signing at the bank.
new_p_367: This is the most common mistake. Many borrowers chase the lowest interest rate without understanding the implications of indexation tracks. A low initial interest rate in an index-linked track may prove very expensive down the road when the principal inflates and monthly payments skyrocket. The right mix is more important than a specific interest rate.
new_p_369: "I've been with this bank since age 16, they'll surely give me a good deal." Wrong! The bank is a business whose goal is to maximize profits. A captive customer is the ideal customer for the bank. You must conduct a comprehensive market survey among all banks and negotiate. Often, a competing bank will offer significantly better terms to recruit you as new customers.
new_p_371: Mortgages are taken for 20 or 30 years. Will your income and expenses remain the same? Family expansion, education expenses, or career changes must be taken into account. Proper planning must include "exit points" and flexibility for changes, an option sometimes forgotten when refinancing and improving terms or taking a new mortgage.
new_p_373: Life insurance, property insurance, file opening fees, appraisals, attorney fees... all of these add up to significant amounts. Sometimes the monthly payment seems reasonable, but with the addition of insurance it becomes financially strangling. It's important to calculate the "total monthly payment" and not just the payment to the bank.
new_p_375: Relying on the bank clerk as an advisor is an inherent conflict of interest. The bank clerk looks out for the bank, a private mortgage consultant looks out for you. The savings achieved through building the right mix and professional negotiation exceed the cost of the consulting itself by tens of times.
new_p_377: The secret to a good mortgage is balance. Balance between stable tracks (fixed interest) and cheap but volatile tracks (prime), and balance between current monthly payments and future repayment capacity.
new_p_378: When we at Ariel Achon provide mortgage consulting, we first build a financial profile of the client. We check not only how much you earn today, but what your plans are for the future. Is a sum of money expected to be released (continuing education fund)? Are you planning to change apartments in 5 years? These questions are critical for choosing the right tracks.
new_p_383: Whether you're facing your first home purchase or considering mortgage refinancing, professional evaluation can save you heartache and significant money. Our team is here to ensure you're making the right move.
new_p_417: One of the critical stages in any mortgage consulting process is building the mix. Understanding the different tracks, the advantages and disadvantages of each, is the key to building a stable and economical loan for years to come.
new_p_419: When we approach taking a mortgage, the bank doesn't offer us a single loan, but rather a combination of several smaller loans, each called a "track". Each track has different characteristics: the type of interest (fixed or variable), indexation (to the Consumer Price Index or non-indexed), and exit stations (the option for early repayment without penalty).
new_p_420: As part of a professional mortgage consulting process, our goal is to build the "mix" – the precise combination between the different tracks – that will suit your financial profile. A proper mix balances risk and opportunity, between monthly payment stability and overall interest savings throughout the life of the loan.
new_p_421: Many mistakenly think that the lowest interest rate is the most important. This is a common mistake. A track with a low initial interest rate can be very dangerous if it's exposed to extreme changes in the index or Bank of Israel interest rate. Therefore, a deep understanding of the tracks is critical.
new_p_423: A review of the common mortgage tracks and what each means for your monthly payment
new_p_425: A track that is not indexed to the CPI, based on the Bank of Israel interest rate plus a fixed margin (1.5%). This is a track that was once very cheap, but today is directly affected by interest rate increases in the economy.
new_p_429: The most stable track. The interest rate is set in advance for the entire period and doesn't change, and the principal is not indexed to CPI. You know exactly how much you'll pay from the first day to the last.
new_p_433: The interest rate changes at "exit stations" (for example every 5 years) according to a specific anchor, and the principal is indexed to the Consumer Price Index. This track usually starts with a low interest rate.
new_p_437: A subsidized loan granted to eligible applicants according to state criteria. Usually involves a fixed interest rate linked to the index under preferential terms.
new_p_441: There is no single "mortgage mix" that suits everyone. A young couple purchasing their first apartment and needing maximum security will receive completely different recommendations than an experienced investor planning to sell the property within a few years.
new_p_442: When we provide mortgage consulting services for first-time buyers, we take into account parameters such as future repayment capacity, expected family growth, and study funds expected to be released. In contrast, when advising home upgraders, the emphasis may be on flexibility and future mortgage recycling.
new_p_443: The wisdom is to balance: combine a "fixed CPI-linked" track for stability, together with a "prime" track for flexibility, and perhaps a small portion in a variable track if early repayment is expected. This is the heart of proper financial planning.

new_p_487: Housing upgraders are a unique group in the real estate world. Unlike first-time buyers, you already have a property in hand, and often an existing mortgage as well. This situation creates a complex equation of timing and finances: Should you sell first and then buy? Or perhaps find your dream apartment and only then put your current apartment up for sale?
new_p_488: This is exactly where the value of professional mortgage consulting comes into play. While first-time home mortgages focus on building a portfolio and interest rates, housing upgraders require broad strategic vision that includes bridging solutions, mortgage transfers, and proper tax planning. A mistake in timing or calculating financial capacity could cost tens of thousands of shekels or even more.
new_p_490: Each decision has financial and bureaucratic implications that are important to understand before setting out on the journey.
new_p_492: You've found your dream apartment and don't want to miss out on it. The advantage is certainty about the new home, but the risk is a large financial commitment before receiving the money from the old apartment.
new_p_497: The financially safer route. You know exactly how much money is available to you. The downside is the need to find an apartment under time pressure or rent an apartment for an interim period.
new_p_502: In the process of mortgage consultation for housing upgraders, we examine a variety of financial tools that can facilitate the transition and save costs:
new_p_504: If you have an existing mortgage with excellent terms (for example, low interest rates from the past), you don't have to pay it off. You can "transfer" it to the new property and maintain the good terms, while covering the difference with a new mortgage. This is a move that can save tens of thousands of shekels compared to taking a completely new mortgage.
new_p_506: A classic solution for situations where you bought before you sold. The bank provides you with a loan against the existing or new apartment, where you pay only the interest (or don't pay at all) for a period of up to two years. The principal is repaid in one lump sum upon selling the old apartment.
new_p_508: The transition is an excellent opportunity to re-examine the loan terms. Sometimes it's more profitable to pay off the old mortgage and take a new one with terms adapted to the current market situation and your updated repayment capacity.
new_p_511: Managing payment dates to the contractor or seller versus the dates of receiving funds from your buyer is critical to preventing contract breach.
new_p_513: Proper planning of the transaction can affect purchase tax and other tax benefits available to you as housing upgraders.
new_p_515: Knowing that there's a professional managing the negotiations with the banks and looking after your interests allows you to focus on the move itself.
new_p_517: Proper combination between the transferred mortgage and the new addition, taking into account changes in family income over the years.

new_p_556: Real estate investment is one of the leading ways in Israel to create financial security. Discover how to plan your financing in a way that maximizes your returns and enables you to grow.
new_p_558: Purchasing an investment property is fundamentally different from buying a home for residence, both in terms of financial objectives and banking regulations. While for a first home you can receive up to 75% financing, the Bank of Israel limits the financing percentage for a second property (investment property) to only 50% of the property value. This restriction requires investors to come with significantly more equity capital or find creative financing solutions.
new_p_559: When we approach mortgage consulting for investors, the main goal is not necessarily to "finish with the mortgage as quickly as possible," but to maximize return on investment (ROI). Sometimes, a longer mortgage with lower monthly payments will allow the rental income to fully cover the loan, thereby creating an asset that finances itself ("income-generating asset").
new_p_561: One of the biggest challenges for investors is raising the required equity capital (50% of the purchased property value). This is where a powerful tool that many are unaware of comes into play: leveraging an existing property. If you own a residential property and the mortgage on it is less than 50% of its value (or there's no mortgage on it at all), you can take an additional mortgage on the existing property.
new_p_566: In the process of mortgage consulting for investors, we examine all variables to ensure the deal will be profitable and secure.
new_p_569: Will the expected rental income cover the mortgage payments? In many cases we prefer index-linked tracks with low initial payments, or "grace" tracks (interest-only payments) for a certain period, to ensure the property doesn't become a monthly burden on your bank account.
new_p_572: Purchasing a second apartment requires payment of purchase tax (from the first shekel). This is a significant amount that must be taken into account in the overall calculation of transaction costs and the required mortgage amount. Improper planning of purchase tax can turn a good deal into a losing transaction.
new_p_575: Many investors plan to sell the property ("exit") after several years. Therefore, it's critical to build a mortgage portfolio that allows early repayment without high exit penalties. The right combination of prime tracks and variable tracks is key to this flexibility.
new_p_577: Banks view investors as a different type of client. The risks and opportunities are different from those of single apartment buyers. new_p_649: Purchasing an apartment is usually the biggest transaction in our lives, and mortgage insurance is an integral part of it. In the process of mortgage consulting, we emphasize not only the interest rates and tracks, but also the accompanying expenses that will stay with you for years.
new_p_651: When the bank grants you a mortgage loan, it takes a significant risk. To protect its money, the bank requires two types of insurance as a condition for receiving the funds: life insurance and structure insurance. Together, they are called 'mortgage insurance'. But it's important to understand – this insurance doesn't just protect the bank, it also provides a critical safety net for you and your family.
new_p_652: As part of first-time home mortgage consulting, many young couples are surprised to discover that the monthly payment isn't just comprised of principal and interest, but also includes a monthly insurance payment that can reach hundreds of shekels. A deep understanding of insurance components can save you thousands of shekels over the life of the mortgage.
new_p_655: The purpose of life insurance is to ensure that in case of the death of one of the borrowers, God forbid, the insurance company will pay the bank the remaining mortgage balance. This prevents a situation where the surviving spouse or heirs are left with a heavy debt they cannot handle, and might lose the home.
new_p_660: Structure insurance is designed to cover physical damage to the property itself, such as fire, earthquake, pipe explosion and natural disasters. The bank requires this insurance to ensure that its collateral (the apartment) doesn't lose its value in case of disaster.
new_p_665: One of the common questions in the mortgage consulting process is where to purchase the insurance. Banks offer mortgage insurance through agencies affiliated with them, and sometimes this seems like the most convenient solution – 'everything in one place'. However, this convenience sometimes has a price.
new_p_666: Purchasing insurance through a private insurance agent or directly from insurance companies may be significantly cheaper. Additionally, private policies may include better extensions and coverage (such as third-party coverage in structure insurance) that aren't always included in the bank's basic policy.
new_p_667: Important tip: Even if you took insurance through the bank, you can switch it at any time to cheaper external insurance, without penalties.
new_p_670: Don't accept the first offer. The market is very competitive, and price gaps can reach tens of percent. A quick check can save hundreds of shekels per year.
new_p_672: Fill out the health declaration seriously. Hiding information could lead to claim rejection at the moment of truth. If your health condition has improved (for example, you stopped smoking), update the policy to reduce the premium.
new_p_674: Just like performing mortgage refinancing and improving interest rate conditions, it's recommended to check your insurance portfolio once every few years. Insurance rates change and new discounts emerge in the market.
new_p_676: Professional mortgage consulting takes into account all costs – including insurance. We'd be happy to help you build a smart mortgage mix that sees your complete financial picture.
new_p_698: Building a private home is one of the most complex and exciting projects in a family's life. Unlike purchasing an apartment from a contractor or second-hand, a self-build mortgage requires precise financial planning, understanding of fund release stages, and close professional guidance.
new_p_700: Many mistakenly think that a mortgage is a uniform product, but when it comes to self-build, the rules of the game change completely. While in a mortgage for purchasing an existing property the bank transfers the money to the seller in one payment or several predefined installments, in a self-build mortgage the money is released "according to construction progress."
new_p_701: This means the bank becomes a partner in your construction process. It won't transfer the entire loan amount on the first day, but will release funds only after verifying (through its appraiser) that you've completed a certain construction stage (such as foundations, structure, finishing, etc.). This process requires meticulous cash flow planning to avoid getting stuck mid-construction without the ability to pay contractors.
new_p_702: This is exactly where the importance of professional mortgage consulting comes in. An experienced advisor will know how to build a mix that takes into account the expected payment schedule, prepare you for unexpected expenses, and ensure money is available exactly when you need it.
new_p_705: In the first stage, financing can be obtained for land purchase. Financing percentages vary according to land status and building permits. This is the foundation on which the future property value will be calculated.
new_p_707: Before actual construction begins, there are many expenses for planning, fees, and levies. Some banks allow financing for this stage as well, but usually initial equity is required.
new_p_709: This is the first major stage. After pouring foundations and erecting the structure, a bank appraiser will approve construction progress and enable release of a significant installment from the mortgage.
new_p_711: The final and most expensive stage. Fund release at this stage is critical for completing the house. Delays here could prevent moving into the home, so early planning is critical.

new_p_750: Buying a home is the biggest transaction of your life, but the property price is just the beginning. Discover all the hidden costs you must factor into your budget planning, and how professional mortgage consulting can save you from expensive surprises.
new_p_752: When young couples or home upgraders approach the process of buying a home, the main focus is usually on the property price itself and the required mortgage amount. This is a common mistake that can lead to a significant budget shortfall. In practice, the additional transaction expenses can reach tens or even hundreds of thousands of shekels, often adding 5% to 10% to the original home price.
new_p_753: In the mortgage consulting process, one of the critical steps is building a complete financial profile of the client. An experienced mortgage advisor doesn't just look at monthly repayment capacity, but examines the real equity remaining to the client after deducting all additional expenses. Ignoring these expenses can lead to a situation where you don't have enough equity to sign the contract or make the first payment to the contractor.
new_p_755: Here's a breakdown of the main costs you'll encounter on your way to homeownership, beyond the property price itself:
new_p_757: An attorney accompanies the transaction from start to finish, including property inspection, contract drafting, and land registry registration. The standard fee usually ranges between 0.5% to 1.5% of the property value plus VAT. When purchasing from a contractor, the law limits the contractor's attorney fee to a fixed amount (about 5,000 NIS plus VAT), but you'll still need your own attorney.
new_p_759: The bank requires an appraiser's evaluation to ensure the property value matches the mortgage amount. The cost of an appraiser from the bank's list usually ranges between 600 to 1,000 NIS for a standard property. If you decide to bring a private appraiser before signing the contract (highly recommended!), the cost may be higher, but it can save you from purchasing a problematic property.
new_p_761: If you used a broker to find the property, the standard cost is 2% of the property price plus VAT. This is a very significant expense to factor into your equity calculation, as the bank doesn't finance brokerage fees as part of the mortgage.
new_p_763: The tax amount depends on the property value and your status (single home, home upgraders, or investors). For a first home, there's an exemption up to a certain ceiling, but above it you pay graduated tax. It's important to check the current tax brackets with the Tax Authority before purchase.
new_p_765: Opening a mortgage file costs 0.25% of the loan amount (negotiable). Additionally, you must factor in the costs of life insurance and building insurance, which are mandatory conditions for obtaining the mortgage. These costs are paid monthly throughout the life of the loan.
new_p_767: When purchasing an off-plan property from a contractor, the remaining unpaid balance is linked to the construction input index. Increases in this index can add tens of thousands of shekels to the final property price until you receive the keys. With proper mortgage consulting, you can plan the payment schedule to minimize this exposure.
new_p_769: Many think a mortgage advisor only deals with interest rates with the bank, but their role is much broader. An essential part of the mortgage consulting process is building a comprehensive financial plan that takes into account all the components we mentioned above.
new_p_770: When we build a mortgage mix, we ensure you have enough liquidity to pay all additional expenses without going into bank overdrafts or taking expensive last-minute loans. Proper planning can include advancing payments to the contractor to prevent index increases, negotiating file opening fees, and adjusting monthly repayments to allow you to maintain a decent standard of living even after moving to the new home.
new_p_771: Additionally, a professional advisor will know how to refer you to reliable professionals (appraisers, attorneys, insurance agents) who will provide you with quality service at fair prices, which can save you thousands of additional shekels along the way.
new_p_773: Don't let additional expenses surprise you. Let's build a smart mortgage plan that takes the full picture into account and saves you money.
new_p_798: Your property is worth a lot of money, and you don't have to sell it to benefit from it. A reverse mortgage allows people aged 60 and above to receive money in exchange for a lien on their home, without monthly repayments and without giving up ownership.
new_p_801: A reverse mortgage is a unique financial product designed for the senior population (usually aged 60 and above). The concept behind the product is simple: many people at retirement age own real estate property outright, but often experience a decline in their regular monthly income or need a significant amount of money for various needs.
new_p_802: Unlike a regular mortgage, where borrowers make monthly payments to the bank to purchase the property, in a reverse mortgage the bank or insurance company provides borrowers with a sum of money (as a lump sum or monthly allowance) against a lien on the existing property. The major advantage is that in most tracks there is no need for regular monthly repayment. The loan is repaid only when the borrowers leave the house, sell it, or pass away (and then the heirs repay the debt or sell the property).
new_p_803: This process requires deep understanding and proper financial planning. This is where the need for professional mortgage consulting services comes into play, which will help you understand the terms, interest rates and long-term implications on inheritance and property value.
new_p_806: Many parents want to help their children with the down payment for a mortgage for their first home. A reverse mortgage allows releasing money from the existing property and giving it to the children as a gift, without affecting the parents' monthly cash flow.
new_p_809: In senior years, medical expenses or the need for assisted living may increase significantly. The money received can be used to finance treatments, a personal caregiver or moving to premium assisted living, while maintaining a high standard of living.
new_p_812: Want to take a trip around the world? Renovate the house? Or simply live with greater comfort? A reverse mortgage allows supplementing pension income and enjoying life without unnecessary financial worries.
new_p_814: The loan amount that can be received is determined by the age of the youngest borrower (the older the age, the higher the financing percentage) and the property value. Usually you can receive between 15% to 50% of the home's value.
new_p_819: It's important to remember that the interest rate on a reverse mortgage is usually higher than a regular residential mortgage, so mortgage consulting is critical for understanding the total costs and comparing between different entities offering the product.
new_p_821: "Before signing a reverse mortgage, involve the children in the decision. Since the loan will ultimately affect the inheritance, family transparency prevents future conflicts and allows everyone to understand the benefits of the process."
new_p_823: Don't do it alone. We will accompany you through the process, compare the different offers from insurance companies and banks for you, and ensure you get the best terms for you and your family.
new_p_849: Business owners and self-employed individuals face unique challenges on their path to their dream home. While employees present pay stubs, you need to prove business stability over time. The following guide will help you organize the process and explain why personalized mortgage consulting is critical for you.
new_p_851: For the bank, the keyword is "stability." When an employee applies for a mortgage, the bank sees a clear and predictable income stream. In contrast, with self-employed individuals, income may vary from month to month, and the business is exposed to various risks that don't exist with employees.
new_p_852: Banks are concerned about situations of declining business income, business closure, or seasonal volatility. Therefore, the review process for self-employed individuals is much more thorough and includes analysis of financial statements from several years back. This is exactly where the value of professional mortgage consulting comes into play – the ability to present the bank with the complete and accurate picture of your business, beyond the dry numbers in the tax assessment.
new_p_855: Unlike employees where the bank looks at their gross income (with certain deductions), for self-employed individuals the bank looks at net profit after expenses and before tax. The bank examines annual tax assessments (Form 1301) from the last two or three years to derive a monthly average.
new_p_857: An important point that many miss: an experienced mortgage advisor will know to ask the bank to add back to the income non-cash expenses, such as depreciation, or one-time financing expenses. This action can significantly increase the recognized income for calculating the repayment ratio.
new_p_859: In addition to tax assessments, the bank will require a CPA confirmation of current year income. If there's a large gap between the current year and previous years, you'll need to provide convincing explanations. Early preparation of the file is critical in such cases.
new_p_861: To receive preliminary mortgage approval, you'll need to prepare an organized file. Unlike employees who only need 3 pay stubs, your list is longer:
new_p_867: Golden tip: Make sure there are no bounced checks or standing orders in the business and personal accounts in the months before submitting the application. Such a "stain" could disqualify the application or significantly increase interest rates.
new_p_869: The mortgage process for self-employed individuals is more complex and requires specific expertise. The bank clerk sees the dry data in the system and often doesn't understand the business potential or the reasons for income volatility. An experienced mortgage advisor knows how to "translate" business language into banking language.
new_p_870: Whether it's an application for first-time home buyer mortgage consulting or for those upgrading their housing, professional guidance includes building a financial profile that presents the business in the best possible light. We know how to deal with low assessments in certain years, explain one-time expenses, and build a mortgage mix that's tailored to your business cash flow.
new_p_872: Don't let bureaucracy stop you. We're here to help you get the best mortgage, with terms that suit your business and family.
new_p_899: Moving homes but don't want to give up the excellent interest rates you have on your current mortgage? Mortgage transfer is the solution for you. In this guide, we'll explain exactly how to execute the process, in which cases it's worthwhile, and how to avoid costly mistakes.
new_p_902: In the field of mortgage consulting, one of the most important concepts for home upgraders is "mortgage transfer." Simply put, this is a process where you transfer your existing mortgage loan from the old property (which you're selling) to the new property (which you're buying), while maintaining the original loan terms.
new_p_903: During periods when market interest rates rise, your old mortgage becomes a financial asset in itself. If you took out a mortgage several years ago at near-zero interest rates, paying it off and taking a new mortgage under current market conditions could cost you hundreds of thousands of shekels over the life of the loan. Mortgage transfer allows you to "drag" the good terms, margins, and interest rates to your next property.
new_p_906: The main reason for performing a transfer. If the interest rates on your current mortgage are significantly lower than the rates currently offered in the market, a transfer will save you substantial money on monthly and total interest payments.
new_p_908: In certain tracks, early repayment of the mortgage involves an early repayment fee (penalty) that can reach tens of thousands of shekels. Mortgage transfer prevents this taxable event and saves the penalty.
new_p_910: Sometimes the old mortgage includes special benefits, cheaper mortgage insurance, or indexation terms that no longer exist in the market. Transfer allows you to preserve the entire loan "package."
new_p_912: The transfer process can be executed in three main ways, depending on the timing of selling the old apartment and purchasing the new one. As part of mortgage consulting for home upgraders, we match the right route to your specific situation:
new_p_914: The ideal but most complex situation to execute. The mortgage transfer is performed on one day when you sell the old apartment and buy the new one. The money from your buyer goes directly to the seller of the new apartment, and the lien is exchanged. Requires perfect coordination between all parties.
new_p_916: If you've already sold the old apartment but haven't yet purchased a new one, the bank allows you to "freeze" the mortgage. The money from the sale is deposited in the bank as collateral against the mortgage, until you find a new property and mortgage it. This is an excellent way not to lose the terms during the interim period.
new_p_918: The most common case among home upgraders. You've purchased a new apartment from a contractor or second-hand, but haven't yet sold the old one. In this case, you can transfer the mortgage to the new property even before removing the lien from the old one, usually through the use of a bridge loan or temporary bank guarantee.
new_p_920: Mortgage transfer isn't always the right move. Sometimes, mortgage refinancing and improving terms might be more worthwhile, even if interest rates have risen. When does this happen? When your original mortgage mix isn't optimal, or when your financial needs have changed fundamentally.
new_p_921: For example, if your original mortgage is index-linked and the index has risen significantly, the principal may not have decreased as you expected. In such a case, building a new and more stable mix (even at a higher nominal interest rate) might be a smarter long-term move. Additionally, sometimes banks create bureaucratic difficulties for transfers to encourage customers to take a new loan at higher interest rates.
new_p_923: Even if you've decided to transfer the mortgage, you'll likely need to add additional money ("mortgage supplement") for the new and more expensive apartment. The bank will price this supplement according to current market interest rates. This is exactly where a mortgage advisor can negotiate for you and secure better terms on the new portion, while preserving the old portion.
new_p_926: Analysis of the existing portfolio against new market offers to ensure that transfer is indeed the most profitable step.
new_p_928: Obtaining approval from the bank for the mortgage transfer and for the additional amount required (if needed).
new_p_930: Conducting an appraisal of the new property to ensure it can serve as adequate collateral for the mortgage.
new_p_932: Signing the transfer documents, updating insurance policies, and transferring the funds.

new_p_997: Savings vary from case to case, but in most cases we're talking about savings of tens of thousands of shekels and sometimes even over 100,000 NIS over the life of the mortgage, resulting from choosing the right tracks, reducing index linkage, and lowering interest rates.

new_p_1129: Buying a home is probably the largest financial transaction you'll make in your lifetime. For most of us, realizing the dream of homeownership requires taking a mortgage – a long-term loan that can accompany us for 20 or even 30 years. This is exactly where mortgage consulting comes into play, which is critical to securing your financial future.
new_p_1131: Many mistakenly think that the bank clerk is their mortgage advisor. It's important to understand: the bank clerk works for the bank, and their goal is to maximize the bank's profits. In contrast, a private and objective mortgage consultant works for you, and their goal is to save you money and build a mortgage mix tailored to your repayment capacity, both now and in the future.
new_p_1132: The consulting process includes an in-depth analysis of your financial situation, understanding future needs (such as family expansion, career changes), and building a strategy for taking a loan under the most optimal terms available in the market.
new_p_1134: Before diving into deep waters, here are some concepts you must know:
new_p_1139: A mortgage mix is the combination of different interest rate tracks. There's no "one good mortgage for everyone." An excellent mortgage for a young couple starting out might be a financial disaster for a family with three children and high expenses. Professional mortgage consulting focuses on building your personal mix, while spreading risks between variable and fixed tracks, and between linked and non-linked tracks.
new_p_1140: Saving a tenth of a percent in interest can accumulate to tens of thousands of shekels over the life of the mortgage. Therefore, negotiating with banks and understanding the small details are critical.
new_p_1142: For first-time home buyers, the challenge is twofold: lack of experience and great excitement that can lead to hasty decisions. The first step is getting preliminary approval from the bank, but don't settle for the first offer. Conduct a market survey, or use a consultant who will do it for you. Remember that quality mortgage consulting is an investment that pays for itself many times over in accumulated savings over the years.
new_p_1149: Buying your first home is an exciting and defining moment, but it comes with quite a few concerns. For most young couples in Israel, the path to homeownership goes through the bank for mortgages. The process may seem complex and intimidating, but with proper preparation and professional guidance from first home mortgage consulting, it can be made simpler and even save significant amounts of money over the years.
new_p_1151: Before you start looking for apartments, it's important to understand your budget. The Bank of Israel limits the financing percentage for a first home to up to 75% of the property value. This means you must bring equity from home of at least 25% of the apartment price. Additionally, you must consider associated expenses not covered by the mortgage: purchase tax (if applicable), attorney fees, brokerage fees, moving costs, and initial renovations.
new_p_1152: Professional mortgage consulting will help you map all your equity sources, including savings, parental assistance, or liquid training funds, to build the most realistic purchase budget for you.
new_p_1154: A common mistake by first-time home buyers is signing a purchase contract before receiving pre-approval from the bank. This is a dangerous mistake that could lead to contract breach and heavy penalties if the bank refuses to approve the loan. Pre-approval is an official document from the bank confirming that based on the data you presented (income, obligations, etc.), the bank is willing to provide you with a loan in a certain amount.
new_p_1155: As part of the first home mortgage consulting process, we will ensure to obtain pre-approval from several banks for you, to guarantee your financing ability and give you peace of mind in your apartment search.
new_p_1157: Young couples are usually at the beginning of their careers, with expectations of salary increases in the future, but also with expenses expected to grow (family expansion, education, etc.). A proper mortgage portfolio for a first home must consider these expected changes.
new_p_1158: For example, you can combine tracks that allow flexibility and early repayment without penalties, in case you want to upgrade your apartment in a few years. It's also important to balance between the current monthly payment and the total interest you'll pay to the bank. A monthly payment that's too low today could cause the mortgage principal to inflate and significantly increase the loan cost.
new_p_1160: Purchasing a first home is an enormous financial step. The difference between a good mortgage and a bad mortgage can amount to hundreds of thousands of shekels. Guidance from an experienced mortgage consultant will ensure you enter the deal with open eyes, with precise financial planning and with the most profitable mortgage possible to obtain.
new_p_1167: A mortgage is a long-term financial product, but our lives and market conditions are dynamic and constantly changing. What was right and economical five years ago may be expensive and unprofitable today. This is where mortgage refinancing and improving conditions comes into play. This is essentially a process where we pay off the old mortgage and take a new mortgage with better terms, adapted to the current situation.
new_p_1169: There are several main situations where it's highly recommended to perform a refinancing feasibility check:
new_p_1174: One of the main considerations in mortgage refinancing is the early repayment fee (exit penalty). Sometimes, the penalty can be high and make refinancing unprofitable. However, as part of professional mortgage consulting, we perform a precise calculation that includes the penalty cost versus the expected interest savings. In many cases, even with paying the penalty, the total savings still amounts to tens of thousands of shekels.
new_p_1176: The refinancing process is essentially similar to taking a new mortgage, but it's usually faster. There's no need to go back to the starting point of purchasing the apartment. A mortgage consultant will examine the existing portfolio, negotiate with your current bank (or other banks competing for you), and build a new and optimal portfolio.
new_p_1177: Remember: Banks won't call you to offer to reduce interest rates. The responsibility to check and save is yours. Checking refinancing feasibility is a smart financial step that every mortgage holder must perform periodically.

new_p_1182: Mortgage pre-approval is the first official document you receive from the bank in the mortgage process. This document serves as confirmation that the bank has reviewed your basic financial data – income, obligations, and credit history – and has agreed in principle to provide you with a loan for property purchase, subject to certain conditions.
new_p_1183: It's important to understand: without pre-approval, you're essentially "walking in the dark." Many couples start the process by searching for an apartment, fall in love with a property, and then discover at the moment of truth that the bank isn't willing to approve the required financing amount. In professional mortgage consulting, we always recommend obtaining approval before the first apartment viewing.
new_p_1187: Before approaching the bank, prepare the paperwork: ID cards and appendices, 3 recent pay stubs (for employees) or tax assessments and CPA confirmations (for self-employed), and bank statements from the last 3 months from all active accounts.
new_p_1189: Today you can submit a pre-approval application through bank websites or telephone centers. This is a relatively quick process that provides initial indication, but it's important to be accurate with the data entered.
new_p_1191: The approval you receive is typically valid for 3 months regarding the bank's willingness to provide credit, but note: interest rate protection is valid for only 24 days! After that, the bank may change the pricing.

new_p_1200: Don't face the bureaucracy alone. Let us help you achieve the best approval.
new_p_1204: The approval obligates the bank to give you the loan, but only on condition that all the data you provided is verified accurately (through documents) and that the property you choose is approved by the bank's appraiser. If discrepancies are discovered between the declaration and reality, the bank may withdraw.
new_p_1206: Absolutely. Obtaining pre-approval from multiple banks allows you to conduct an initial market survey and compare terms. However, in the final negotiation stage, it's recommended to use a mortgage advisor to manage the tender efficiently and not "burn" yourself with the banks.
new_p_1208: Through digital channels, you can receive initial approval within minutes to 24 hours. When dealing with a banker at a branch or through a mortgage advisor, the process may take several days, but it will usually be more accurate and tailored to your complex needs.
new_p_1210: Don't take unnecessary risks. Our team at "Mortgage in Pajamas" will accompany you from the pre-approval stage until you receive the keys, with confidence and peace of mind.
new_p_1214: Did you buy a new apartment from a contractor? Congratulations! But did you know that the price in the contract is not necessarily the final price you'll pay? Meet the factor that can make your apartment tens of thousands of shekels more expensive – and how to deal with it.
new_p_1216: The Construction Input Index is a statistical figure published by the Central Bureau of Statistics (CBS) on the 15th of each month. The index reflects changes in construction costs for residential apartments and offices in Israel. It measures changes in material prices (such as concrete, iron, cement), workers' wages, mechanical engineering equipment, and more.
new_p_1217: When you purchase an apartment "on paper" or during construction stages from a contractor, in the vast majority of cases, the remaining payment you haven't yet paid is linked to this index. This means that if the index rises, your debt to the contractor increases accordingly. This is a mechanism designed to protect the contractor from raw material price increases, but in practice it places significant financial risk on the buyers.
new_p_1221: An annual increase of 2-3% in the Construction Input Index on a remaining debt of one million shekels means an addition of 20,000-30,000 NIS to the apartment price in just one year. Spread over 3-4 years of construction, this could amount to 100,000 NIS or more.
new_p_1223: Mortgage banks usually do not finance index additions as part of the original approved mortgage (unless prepared for this in advance). This means you will often need to bring these differences from home as additional equity at the last minute.
new_p_1225: It's important to know about the recent Sale Law amendment that came into effect, which limits indexing to only 40% of the apartment price and exempts from indexing after the contractual delivery date. An experienced mortgage advisor will know to check whether your contract meets the requirements of the new law.
new_p_1227: One of the most common questions among apartment buyers from contractors is whether it's worthwhile to advance payments to the contractor. On one hand, advancing payment "neutralizes" the index on the amount paid. On the other hand, to pay early, you usually need to take the mortgage earlier and start paying interest to the bank.
new_p_1229: There's no one correct answer for everyone. The decision depends on index expectations versus the interest rate level in the economy. During periods when the index rises sharply and interest rates are low, advancing payments is usually profitable. Conversely, when interest rates are high and the index is moderate, it might be better to wait.
new_p_1234: Don't let the Construction Input Index surprise you. Proper planning of the payment schedule and smart mortgage management can save you significant amounts. We're here to build the most profitable strategy for you.
new_p_1269: Before diving into loan tracks and interest rates, you need to understand the numbers. The complete guide to planning the down payment required for purchasing an apartment, and how to avoid common mistakes on the way to getting your keys.
new_p_1271: When we approach taking a mortgage, the bank looks at two main parameters: our monthly repayment capacity, and the down payment we bring to the transaction. Down payment is essentially the amount of money you pay from your own pocket for the apartment, before the bank completes the balance through the mortgage loan.
new_p_1272: As part of the mortgage consultation process, the first step is always analyzing the existing down payment. The reason for this is that the Bank of Israel has set strict rules regarding the maximum financing percentages that banks are allowed to provide. Without sufficient down payment, it's impossible to receive preliminary mortgage approval, so proper planning of financing sources is critical even before signing a purchase contract.
new_p_1274: For first-time home buyers (those without housing), the Bank of Israel allows financing of up to 75% of the property value. This means you must bring down payment of at least 25% of the apartment price.
new_p_1275: Example: For an apartment worth 2 million ₪, a down payment of 500,000 ₪ is required.
new_p_1276: Those who sell an existing apartment and buy another one in its place are entitled to financing of up to 70% of the new property value. In this case, the required down payment is 30%.
new_p_1277: There's an obligation to sell the old apartment within a specified timeframe (usually 18 months).
new_p_1279: For a second apartment and beyond (investment property), the bank may approve financing of only up to 50%. This means you must bring half of the property value from home.
new_p_1280: This is a high entry threshold that requires precise financial planning.
new_p_1282: Many ask themselves: "Where do I get the initial money?". This is one of the biggest challenges for young couples in Israel. As part of first-time home mortgage consultation, we map out all possible sources:
new_p_1287: A critical point that many are unaware of is that the bank calculates the financing percentage based on the lower of the two: the contract price or the appraiser's valuation.
new_p_1288: If you purchased an apartment for 2 million NIS, but the bank's appraiser valued it at only 1.8 million NIS, the bank will give you 75% of the 1.8 million. The implication? You'll have a 'gap' in your budget that you need to cover immediately from your own equity.
new_p_1289: Mortgage advisor tip: In borderline cases or in areas where prices are rising rapidly, it's recommended to conduct an 'early appraisal' before signing the contract, so you know exactly how much mortgage you can get and avoid unpleasant surprises.
new_p_1291: The mortgage loan is the biggest commitment of your life. Improper planning of equity can drag you into supplementary loans at very high interest rates that will burden your monthly payments. An experienced mortgage advisor knows how to build a smart mix, find creative solutions for equity completion (such as bridge loans or mortgaging parents' existing property with due caution), and negotiate with banks to maximize your financing terms.
new_p_1294: A mortgage is not a single loan, but a combination of several different tracks. The right choice of portfolio is the most important financial decision you'll make in the process – even more than the interest rate level.
new_p_1296: When we approach the mortgage consulting process, the first and most important concept that comes to the table is the "mortgage portfolio". Many tend to think that a mortgage is one large loan, but in practice, it's a reverse investment portfolio composed of several small loans (tracks), each with different characteristics: interest type, indexation type, duration, and exit points.
new_p_1297: Building the right portfolio is an art that combines risk management with opportunity utilization. An optimal portfolio is not just one that presents the lowest monthly payment today, but one that will maintain stability over the years, allow flexibility for future changes, and save you unnecessary interest and indexation payments in the long term.
new_p_1298: The bank, as a business entity, will usually offer a portfolio that is profitable for them or one that looks attractive at first glance but is exposed to risks. Our role in mortgage consulting is to build for you the portfolio that serves only your interests.
new_p_1301: Like in an investment portfolio, you shouldn't put all your eggs in one basket. A proper portfolio combines indexed tracks with non-indexed tracks, and variable rates with fixed rates, to protect you from extreme market fluctuations.
new_p_1303: Do you anticipate receiving a sum of money in the future (like a training fund)? A smart portfolio will incorporate "exit points" and tracks without early repayment fees, allowing you to reduce the debt without unnecessary penalties.
new_p_1305: The monthly payment should be tailored to your available income today and in the future. We consider expected changes like family expansion or salary increases, and adjust the amortization schedule (spitzer or equal principal) accordingly.
new_p_1307: In the mortgage world, there's no "magic solution" that fits everyone. What's good for your friends might be a financial disaster for you. When we provide mortgage consulting for first-time buyers or those upgrading their housing, we examine several strategies:
new_p_1311: Important to remember: An overly aggressive portfolio based on variable rates may seem cheap today, but could lead to a sharp jump in monthly payments in a few years.
new_p_1313: Mortgage clerks at banks are professionals, but they are subject to the bank's targets and policies. Often, they will offer the bank's standard portfolio (for example, division into thirds) that is easy for them to sell and profitable for the bank.
new_p_1314: Private and objective mortgage consulting changes the picture. We come to negotiations with the bank with a ready and pre-calculated portfolio, tailored exactly to your needs. We know exactly where pressure can be applied to lower interest rates and which track to focus on. The difference between a generic portfolio and a personally tailored one can amount to savings of tens or even hundreds of thousands of shekels over the life of the mortgage.
new_p_1315: Additionally, an experienced consultant sees the full picture: they take into account the construction input index (if you purchased from a contractor), associated insurance costs, and the family's future financial plans.
new_p_1317: Don't leave the biggest financial decision of your life to chance. Contact us today for a consultation meeting without obligation, and together we'll build a mortgage that fits your needs perfectly.
new_p_1354: Spitzer, equal principal, or bullet? Understanding the numbers behind your mortgage and how choosing the right amortization schedule affects your wallet for years to come.
new_p_1357: When we approach taking out a mortgage, most of our attention is usually focused on selecting the tracks (prime, fixed, variable) and the interest rate level. However, there is another critical component that dramatically affects the monthly payment and the total interest we'll pay to the bank in the end – this is the amortization schedule. As part of professional mortgage consulting, we place great emphasis on matching the loan repayment method to the family's financial capabilities, not only in the present but also in the future.
new_p_1358: An amortization schedule is essentially the table that defines how much we'll pay each month toward the principal (the amount we borrowed) and how much toward interest. Understanding this mechanism is vital for anyone planning first-time home buyer mortgage consultation or considering refinancing, as the choice between a Spitzer schedule and equal principal can change the repayment picture by thousands of shekels.
new_p_1360: The Spitzer schedule is the most common repayment method in Israel and the Western world. The guiding principle of this method is that the monthly payment (before indexation and interest rate changes) remains fixed throughout the entire life of the loan.
new_p_1361: How does it work? At the beginning, the lion's share of the monthly payment consists of interest payment, and only a small portion reduces the principal. As time passes, the ratio reverses: the interest component decreases and the principal component increases. This is an excellent solution for young couples seeking stability in cash flow.
new_p_1365: In the "equal principal" method, the amount that reduces the principal (the original debt) is fixed in each payment. Interest is calculated on the remaining debt balance which keeps decreasing, so the total monthly payment starts high and decreases steadily over the years.
new_p_1366: This method is particularly suitable in the context of mortgage consultation for home upgraders or people with high current repayment capacity who want to save on total interest payments over the life of the loan. The interest savings can reach tens of thousands of shekels compared to the Spitzer schedule.
new_p_1371: Suitable for most borrowers, especially young couples in the process of purchasing their first home who need a low initial monthly payment to meet the repayment ratio required by the bank.
new_p_1372: The bottom line: stability and convenience in cash flow.
new_p_1374: Suitable for those with high and available income, or older people who want to finish the mortgage as quickly as possible and pay minimum interest to the bank.
new_p_1375: The bottom line: maximum interest savings.
new_p_1377: In this method, you pay only interest (or nothing) for a defined period, and the principal at the end. Suitable as a bridging solution, for example for home upgraders waiting to sell their old property.
new_p_1378: The bottom line: excellent temporary solution.
new_p_1380: Important to remember: The term "fixed payment" in the Spitzer schedule is only accurate as long as the interest rate doesn't change and the principal isn't linked to an index. In index-linked tracks, the principal balance is updated monthly according to changes in the Consumer Price Index. When the principal increases, both the interest calculation and the monthly payment are updated upward.
new_p_1381: In the process of mortgage refinancing and improving terms, we examine not only the interest rates but also the linkage composition and the amortization schedule. Sometimes, switching from a Spitzer schedule to Equal Principal (if cash flow allows) can provide better protection against inflation, as the principal erodes faster.
new_p_1383: Don't just look at the first payment! Ask the advisor or bank for a simulation showing the development of the monthly payment under realistic inflation assumptions. What seems cheap today could prove very expensive in 5 years.

services_h3_9: From first home to mortgage refinancing - we're here for you at every step
services_p_17: Buying your first home is one of the most significant and exciting steps in life. We understand that the process can seem complex and intimidating, which is why we offer comprehensive first home mortgage consulting that accompanies you from start to finish.
services_p_18: Our service includes a detailed explanation of all available mortgage types, checking your eligibility for mortgages and government benefits, and managing interest rate tenders between different banks. We'll help you understand all required documents and accompany you to every bank meeting.
services_p_19: As part of our mortgage consulting, we'll build a detailed financial plan for you that shows exactly how much you can afford, what the expected monthly payment will be, and how the mortgage will affect your financial situation over the years. Our goal is to ensure you start life in your new home with peace of mind and financial security.
services_p_20: If you already have a mortgage, you might be paying too much! The mortgage market is constantly changing, and interest rates that were competitive a few years ago may be too high today. Mortgage refinancing and terms improvement can save you thousands of shekels per year.
services_p_21: We specialize in comprehensive review of your existing mortgage and identifying savings opportunities. We'll examine the interest rate you're currently paying, your mortgage terms, and various options for improvement. Then, we'll approach all relevant banks and financial institutions to find you the best offer.
services_p_22: The mortgage refinancing process also includes checking early fees, calculating expected long-term savings, and ensuring the switch is truly worthwhile. We'll handle all the small details and ensure the process runs smoothly without unpleasant surprises. Our mortgage consulting guarantees you'll receive the best possible terms.
services_p_23: The family is growing and it's time to move to a larger home? Housing upgrade is a significant step that requires careful financial planning. We provide mortgage consulting for housing upgraders that takes into account your existing mortgage and finds the optimal solution for the move.
services_p_24: As part of our mortgage consulting, we'll examine your current mortgage, assess the value of your existing property, and check various options for financing the new apartment. Should you sell the current apartment first? Is it better to keep it and rent it out? We'll help you make the right decision according to your financial situation and goals.
services_p_25: We'll also coordinate between selling the old property and purchasing the new one, check options for bridge mortgage if needed, and ensure the transition is smooth without excessive financial pressure. Our goal is to help you upgrade your housing while maintaining financial stability and minimizing risks.
services_p_26: Every person is unique, and so are their financial needs. We believe there's no one-size-fits-all solution, which is why we offer precise and personalized mortgage matching services. We'll build a mortgage that fits exactly your needs, your financial situation, and your future plans.
services_p_27: The process begins with an in-depth introductory meeting where we learn about your financial situation, income and expenses, future plans, and financial goals. Based on this information, we build a personalized mortgage plan that takes into account all relevant parameters.
services_p_28: We examine different types of mortgages - fixed, variable, or combined interest rate mortgages, index-linked or non-linked mortgages, and more. We'll explain the advantages and disadvantages of each option and recommend the optimal combination for you. Our mortgage consulting ensures you receive a solution that fits you exactly.
services_p_29: Proper management of family finances is the key to financial stability and achieving long-term financial goals. We offer comprehensive financial consulting that helps you manage your family budget smartly and efficiently.
services_p_30: We'll start by building a complete picture of your financial situation - income, fixed and variable expenses, debts and financial obligations. We'll identify savings opportunities and build a customized budget plan that will help you achieve your financial goals.
services_p_31: The service also includes consulting on topics such as long-term savings, building an emergency fund, retirement planning, and more. We'll help you understand where your money goes and how to manage it better. The goal is to give you complete control over your finances and ensure a secure financial future for your family.
services_p_32: Your pension portfolio is one of your most important assets, and it will significantly impact your quality of life in retirement. Despite this, many of us don't know what's in our pension portfolio or if it's managed optimally.
services_p_33: We offer comprehensive pension portfolio review services. We'll check the funds and tracks you're investing in, examine their performance over time, and compare them to market alternatives. We'll also check the fees you're paying and ensure they're reasonable.
services_p_34: Based on the review, we'll provide professional recommendations for improving your pension portfolio. This may include transferring to better-performing funds, changing investment tracks, reducing fees, and more. The goal is to maximize returns on your pension savings and ensure you have a comfortable and dignified retirement.
